meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Somalia's Rocky New Reality In Somalia, the outlines of a new reality emerged after 15 years of anarchy. The transitional government called for international peacekeepers and a surrender of weapons. No major force challenged the new leadership, although warlords still command authority.PAGE A6

Health Care Tops Agenda Within days of Congress's convening on Thursday, House Democrats plan to rush through legislation requiring the government to negotiate lower drug prices for Medicare beneficiaries and overturning President Bush's restrictions on embryonic stem cell research.

Web Sites Without Rules As popular Web sites like YouTube and MySpace restrict their content, new sites that allow live video chats with no restrictions are growing in popularity, particularly among young users with Web cams, raising concern among child-safety advocates.
Final Farewell For a President And His Circle President Bush and Laura Bush paid their respects at the coffin of Gerald R. Ford in the Capitol Rotunda.
At Mr. Ford's funeral this morning in the Washington National Cathedral, the alumni of his administration will celebrate his life and the intimate circle he created.
Among them will be Henry A. Kissinger, who is back in the limelight and is to eulogize Mr. Ford.

At Mr. Ford's funeral this morning in the Washington National Cathedral, the alumni of his administration will celebrate his life and the intimate circle he created.
Among them will be Henry A. Kissinger, who is back in the limelight and is to eulogize Mr. Ford.
